data.title: It's Average!
data.text: My first time visiting this place and I will not be returning. My four year old enjoys pizza and I enjoy trying out different pizzerias. This place is not too far from home and had pretty good reviews so was worth a try. It looks like a nice place to dine in with friends and the food doesn't taste horrible or anything it just really didn't hit the spot. The pizza I expected to be hotter and better than papa johns,dominoes , and Pizza Hut. Sadly it was not. I got home and realized we didn't get our salad with our order and I am pretty sure I was the only customer. The manager was really,really nice and even offered to bring it to me but I said I could pick it up another day. My daughter said the fettuccine Alfredo wasn't the best but not bad. So I guess over all it was average but still looks like it can be fun for a dine in but I am sure I will never know.

data.title: Great inexpensive Italian food... Great staff
data.text: You will enjoy the baked ziti, and the pizza is amazing. The restaurant is very kid friendly will make anything for them. It's very clean. The most wonderful wait staff around.

data.title: Good with possibilities to be really good
data.text: We stopped in on a Friday night and had bruscetta and pizza.  The appetizer was decent, but not great.  The pizza was a nice mix of both New York and Chicago style pizza's.

data.title: $5.95 lunch specials
data.text: This was my first visit since Luigi's took over.  Lunch at $5.95 is a bargain with several dishes to chose from.  I went with stromboli stuffed with ground Italian sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms & cheese.  The dough was very good, so I imagine the pizza is good as well.  There's a good marinara dipping sauce on the side.  Lunch comes with soup or salad---the tomato basil soup is very good, tastes homemade.  Served with bread which was probably store-bought, nothing special.  However, there was a problem--the stuffing inside the stromboli was at room temperature.  After a couple bites, I sent it back and they managed to heat it to where, though not hot, it was warm enough to be acceptable.  My waiter did not check with me to ask if it was at an ok temp.  I don't think he was ignoring me, he was young and just seemed timid.  This strip center space is small, clean, but not particlarlly cozy.  A lunch special, spaghetti & 2 meatballs looked good.

data.title: Taste of Italy
data.text: Luigi's has become a favorite for our family. Recently we visited Italy and experienced fresh pizza. We love the authentic taste of Luigi's Margherita pizza but we add pepperoni for additional flavor. We haven't found a pizza we enjoy more than this.

data.title: Might try again
data.text: I got a small pepperoni to go. Turned out quite undercooked. Flabby, it couldn't hold a fold. Cheese slid off. Ended up tossing the whole thing. Surely not normal or they couldn't stay in business.

data.title: Excellent Value for Pizza
data.text: On a whim decided to call in a pizza for me to pick up on my way home one evening.  This is an excellent pizza place!  Had my usual three topping medium pizza and for the modest price I had enough pizza for lunch the next day.  Crust is New York style pizza and it was absolutely delicious.  Fast, friendly service, my pizza was ready in ten minutes.

data.title: Great Food Friendly Service
data.text: Found this place through a co-worker.  They have very good Italian food.  Everything I have tried has been excellent.  Lunch specials are really good also.  The service is top notch.  Every time I go I see a lot of take out being picked up.  The pizza is real good  but pasta dishes are excellent.  Please come try iy.
